it.unipd.dei.ims.datacitation.groundtruth

Class GroundTruthBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipd.dei.ims.datacitation.groundtruth.GroundTruthBuilder

  • public class GroundTruthBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the methods to process the raw files from which the ground-truth has to be created. It allows us to create the ground-truth file.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Gianmaria Silvello

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GroundTruthBuilder()
      The constructor which setups the input and output folders and the number of samples.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createGroundTruthFile()
      It creates and prints to file the ground truth composed by three columns separated by a tab.
      void generateAndSampleCitationPaths()
      Creates the ground-truth folders containing the xpaths to be cited, the machine readable and the human-readable references.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> readGroundTruth(boolean test)
      Read the ground truth and return an hash map with xpaths as keys and machine readable references as values.
      void sampleAndStoreRawFiles()
      Selects at random the indicated number of samples from the input files and stores them in the output folder. * It deletes any content of the output folder.

    • Method Detail

      • sampleAndStoreRawFiles

        public void sampleAndStoreRawFiles()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Selects at random the indicated number of samples from the input files and stores them in the output folder. * It deletes any content of the output folder.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • generateAndSampleCitationPaths

        public void generateAndSampleCitationPaths()
                                    throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                           javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException,
                                           javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        Creates the ground-truth folders containing the xpaths to be cited, the machine readable and the human-readable references. The xpaths are created automatically by randomly sampling all the possible xpaths to be cited and selecting among them a number of samples for each file as indicated in the properties.
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        java.io.IOException
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

      • createGroundTruthFile

        public void createGroundTruthFile()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        It creates and prints to file the ground truth composed by three columns separated by a tab. The first column contains the name of the XML file, the second the xpath to be cited and the third the machine readable reference.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readGroundTruth

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> readGroundTruth(boolean test)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Read the ground truth and return an hash map with xpaths as keys and machine readable references as values.
        Parameters:
        test - true if we are doing a test, false if we are validating the model
        Returns:
        An hash map with xpaths as keys and machine readable references as values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
